documents.title: sheffield 's sea cadets help victims of yorkshire floods
text: sheffield 's sea cadets and adult volunteers have responded to the recent floods in yorkshire by opening the unit for the public to bring in donations .
everything from food and clothes to mops for cleaning was loaded onto a minibus and taken to the calder valley in west yorkshire , one of the worst-hit areas .
sea cadet tom gregory , 14 , initiated the campaign after seeing news of the flooding that had taken place in northern england and other areas over christmas .
to hear more on this story listen to bbc radio sheffield 's drive show when they 'll be speaking to some of the cadets .

documents.title: toilet revamp at thomas crapper 's birthplace
text: a £ 30,000 project to refurbish the public toilets in the birthplace of legendary lavatory maker thomas crapper is set to begin .
the facilities at the green in thorne will undergo renovation after funding was secured from the town centre innovation fund and doncaster council .
the work , due to start on monday , is expected to take six weeks to complete .
author: Oliver Wright

documents.title: rotherham council objects to smithy wood motorway services plans
text: rotherham council has objected to plans to build a new motorway service station on ancient woodland between thorpe hesley and chapeltown .
it says the £ 40m development near junction 25 of the m1 would have a detrimental impact on the ecology of smithy wood , and it says it will spoil views out of the borough .
there have already been public protests against the proposal which developers say would create around 700 jobs .
the final decision lies with sheffield city council .
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield, Local Live

documents.title: south yorkshire brothers sentenced for tobacco crime
text: three men from south yorkshire have been jailed for their involvement in the distribution and sale of illicit cigarettes , tobacco and alcohol worth hundreds of thousands of pounds in lost duty and taxes
irvin dunn ( below ) , aged 56 , was sentenced to three years at sheffield crown court today .
his brother wayne dunn ( below ) 57 , from abbeyfield road in sheffield was jailed for 21 months .
lee pearson , 33 , from wilberforce road , south anston , sheffield pleaded guilty to conspiracy to evade duty and was jailed for 12 months , suspended for 18 months .
hm revenue and customs say irvin dunn orchestrated the fraud from behind bars using coded messages .
two men from ireland were also given suspended sentences .
author: Katie Galbraith
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: man appears in sheffield court over new year 's eve murder
text: a man has appeared in court charged with the murder of 41-year-old zabair hussain in sheffield on new year 's eve .
mr hussain was discovered badly injured on staniforth road , in darnall , where he later died .
idris sadiq , 30 , of darnall road , appeared at sheffield magistrates ' court , where he was remanded to appear at the city 's crown court on 4 february .
two other men arrested in connection with the incident have been released on bail .
author: Katie Galbraith
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: inquest opens into askern crash deaths
text: i 've been at the inquest into the deaths of andy and fay tomlinson and their friend mandy deere in askern who were hit and killed by a car on boxing day evening .
the court heard how andy and fay tomlinson were pronounced dead by paramedics at the scene of the crash on sutton road .
mandy deere was taken to the northern general hospital in sheffield but sadly passed away in the early hours of the next morning .
mandy 's husband john is currently in a critical condition in hospital .
doncaster coroner nicola mundy has released the bodies of the three victims to their families to allow funerals to take place .
the inquests were adjourned to allow for a criminal case into the deaths to take place .
author: Kevin Larkin, Doncaster reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: paralympic table tennis player from south yorkshire says he ca n't wait for rio 2016
text: paralympic table tennis star will bayley has been speaking to bbc radio sheffield at the launch of a campaign to promote the gb paralympic team .
will trains around six hours a day at the english institute of sport in sheffield .
the young athlete won a silver medal at london 2012 and is hoping to repeat his success in rio 2016 .
he said he wants `` to be remembered as one of the best players of all time '' .
`` i 'll take it one day at a time try and work as hard as i can every day and i know i 'll be in a good position in rio .
i 've been thinking about it since 2012 . ''
today the public have been urged to 'supercharge paralym gb ' in a major new fundraising campaign .

documents.title: plans to turn old rawmarsh library building into accommodation for vulnerable young people
text: there 's controversy over plans for the old rawmarsh library building in parkgate in rotherham .
the action housing association say they want to turn it into accommodation for vulnerable young people aged between 16 and 24 .
some local people are worried and have started a petition against the plan .
helen greig , chief executive of the action housing association , says they do support drug and alcohol users in other projects .
however , the building in rawmarsh will be there to help young people who ca n't live at home and who want to go into training , education or employment .
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: homes evacuated as family escape 'serious fire ' in doncaster
text: a family have escaped a serious fire at their home on apley road in hyde park , doncaster , south yorkshire fire service says .
four fire engines from maltby , doncaster , aston park and edlington stations were called to the incident on wednesday afternoon .
the fire was in a bedroom of the mid-terrace house .
the family were already outside when the crews arrived , a man was suffering from the effects of breathing in smoke .
both neighbouring properties wee evacuated as a precaution .
an investigation into the cause of the fire will now take place .

documents.title: hillsborough tragedy : this year 's anfield memorial will be the final one
text: this april 's anfield memorial service to remember 96 football fans who died at hillsborough will be the last one , victims ' families have agreed .
memorial services have been held at liverpool 's stadium most years since the disaster at sheffield wednesday 's ground on 15 april 1989 .
the decision to end the anfield services was made by the hillsborough family support group ( hfsg ) following consultation with the relatives of those who died .
the coroner at the inquests into the fatal crush at the sheffield stadium will start summing up evidence later this month .

documents.title: work begins on sheffield 's £ 65m new era
text: work has started on a £ 65m 'chinatown ' development close to sheffield city centre .
construction is now under way on new era square , a 20-storey scheme featuring shops , food and drink outlets , student flats and office space .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: day centre for homeless in sheffield marks 25th anniversary
text: twenty-five years ago today , st wilfrid 's centre on queens road in sheffield opened its doors .
the day centre is open to homeless , vulnerable and socially excluded adults aged between 18 and 65 years old .
throughout the years , they 've helped and supported thousands of people .
